clusters.title: Coroners’ prevention of future deaths reports should be legally enforced | Letters
clusters.neutral_headline: Coroners’ prevention of future deaths reports should be legally enforced

items.title: Coroners’ prevention of future deaths reports should be legally enforced | Letters
items.standfirst: Christine and Francis Saunders, who lost their beloved daughter Juliet, respond to the news that advice on maternal deaths in England and Wales has been routinely ignoredThank you for your article on how coroners’ prevention of future deaths (PFD) reports are being routinely ignored (Coroners’ advice on maternal deaths in England and Wales routinely ignored, study finds, 19 November).Experience has shown us that a coroner’s PFD report is issued in response to serious systemic failings and a trust’s inaction to prevent future tragedies. Tolerating poor care and refusing to learn seem to be shared features of health scandals, including the treatment of people with learning disabilities, such as our own beloved daughter, Juliet Saunders, who died aged 25. Continue reading...
items.content: Christine and Francis Saunders, who lost their beloved daughter Juliet, respond to the news that advice on maternal deaths in England and Wales has been routinely ignoredThank you for your article on how coroners’ prevention of future deaths (PFD) reports are being routinely ignored (Coroners’ advice on maternal deaths in England and Wales routinely ignored, study finds, 19 November).Experience has shown us that a coroner’s PFD report is issued in response to serious systemic failings and a trust’s inaction to prevent future tragedies. Tolerating poor care and refusing to learn seem to be shared features of health scandals, including the treatment of people with learning disabilities, such as our own beloved daughter, Juliet Saunders, who died aged 25. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A study found coroners' advice on maternal deaths is often ignored.
The article discusses the importance of enforcing prevention reports.
The reports address systemic failings to prevent future tragedies.
The author shares personal experience of a similar health scandal.
The article highlights the need for accountability in healthcare.

clusters.title: Why thousands of NHS GPs are cutting their hours despite plan to increase access to doctors
clusters.neutral_headline: Thousands of NHS GPs cut hours despite plan to increase access

items.title: Why thousands of NHS GPs are cutting their hours despite plan to increase access to doctors
items.standfirst: Just one in 13 early career GPs work full-time, NHS figures show, with job stress and childcare significant factorsMuch of the health secretary’s plans to reinvent the NHS hinge on moving services from bed-blocked, overstretched hospitals to “neighbourhood health centres” where possible, and to general practice.However, while Wes Streeting hopes to make it easier for patients to see their doctor, thousands of GPs have been dramatically cutting back their surgery hours in recent years. Continue reading...
items.content: Just one in 13 early career GPs work full-time, NHS figures show, with job stress and childcare significant factorsMuch of the health secretary’s plans to reinvent the NHS hinge on moving services from bed-blocked, overstretched hospitals to “neighbourhood health centres” where possible, and to general practice.However, while Wes Streeting hopes to make it easier for patients to see their doctor, thousands of GPs have been dramatically cutting back their surgery hours in recent years. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Many GPs are reducing their working hours in the NHS.
Job stress and childcare are significant factors in this trend.
The government plans to shift services to neighborhood health centers.
The health secretary aims to improve patient access to doctors.
Only a small percentage of early career GPs work full-time.

clusters.title: We know ultra-processed foods are bad for you – but can you spot them? Take our quiz
clusters.neutral_headline: Ultra-processed foods are bad for you – but can you spot them?

items.title: We know ultra-processed foods are bad for you – but can you spot them? Take our quiz
items.standfirst: Test your knowledge in eight questions to prove you know your onions from your emulsifiersA major global report released this week linked ultra-processed foods to harm in every major human organ. For people in the US, the UK and Australia, these foods make up more than half the calories they consume each day.But it’s not always easy to tell which foods are ultra-processed.Group one: unprocessed or minimally processed foods including whole fruits and vegetables, milk, oats and rice.Group two: processed basic ingredients used in cooking including salt, sugar and vegetable oils.Group three: processed foods made by adding items from groups one and two. Includes canned legumes, bread and cheese.Group four: ultra-processed foods which are commercial products made from extracts of foods, often with added chemicals, flavours and other ingredients you wouldn’t find in a home kitchen.With thanks to Dr Priscila Machado from the Institute for Physical Activity and Nutrition at Deakin University for checking this quiz for accuracy Continue reading...
items.content: Test your knowledge in eight questions to prove you know your onions from your emulsifiersA major global report released this week linked ultra-processed foods to harm in every major human organ. For people in the US, the UK and Australia, these foods make up more than half the calories they consume each day.But it’s not always easy to tell which foods are ultra-processed.Group one: unprocessed or minimally processed foods including whole fruits and vegetables, milk, oats and rice.Group two: processed basic ingredients used in cooking including salt, sugar and vegetable oils.Group three: processed foods made by adding items from groups one and two. Includes canned legumes, bread and cheese.Group four: ultra-processed foods which are commercial products made from extracts of foods, often with added chemicals, flavours and other ingredients you wouldn’t find in a home kitchen.With thanks to Dr Priscila Machado from the Institute for Physical Activity and Nutrition at Deakin University for checking this quiz for accuracy Continue reading...

ai_summary: A major report linked ultra-processed foods to harm in all organs.
These foods make up over half of calories consumed in some countries.
The article includes a quiz to test knowledge of food processing.
The quiz categorizes foods into different processing groups.
The article highlights the health risks associated with these foods.

clusters.title: Labour MPs urge Reeves to drop private finance plans for NHS buildings
clusters.neutral_headline: Labour MPs Oppose Private Finance for NHS Buildings

items.title: Labour MPs urge Reeves to drop private finance plans for NHS buildings
items.standfirst: Chancellor told PFI-style schemes familiar from New Labour era are ‘fiscal illusion’ offering no value for moneyRachel Reeves has been urged by 40 Labour MPs to drop plans to fund NHS buildings with private finance initiatives (PFI) that would saddle the health service with debt.The Labour MPs, including Cat Eccles, Clive Lewis and Rebecca Long-Bailey, pressed the chancellor to commit to investment in the NHS without the use of private capital and warned that a return to the New Labour era of private funding for public projects would be damaging for trust in the government. Continue reading...
items.content: Chancellor told PFI-style schemes familiar from New Labour era are ‘fiscal illusion’ offering no value for moneyRachel Reeves has been urged by 40 Labour MPs to drop plans to fund NHS buildings with private finance initiatives (PFI) that would saddle the health service with debt.The Labour MPs, including Cat Eccles, Clive Lewis and Rebecca Long-Bailey, pressed the chancellor to commit to investment in the NHS without the use of private capital and warned that a return to the New Labour era of private funding for public projects would be damaging for trust in the government. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Forty Labour MPs urged the Chancellor to drop private finance plans for NHS buildings.
They cited concerns about debt and a lack of value for money in PFI-style schemes.
MPs warned against returning to private funding for public projects.
The MPs believe such a return would damage trust in the government.
The MPs want investment in the NHS without private capital involvement.

items.title: Overseas-trained doctors leaving the UK in record numbers
items.standfirst: Medical bodies warn that hostility towards migrants is behind a 26% rise in departures that imperils NHS Record numbers of overseas-trained doctors are quitting the UK, leaving the NHS at risk of huge gaps in its workforce, with hostility towards migrants blamed for the exodus.In all, 4,880 doctors who qualified in another country left the UK during 2024 – a rise of 26% on the 3,869 who did so the year before – figures from the General Medical Council reveal. Continue reading...
items.content: Medical bodies warn that hostility towards migrants is behind a 26% rise in departures that imperils NHS Record numbers of overseas-trained doctors are quitting the UK, leaving the NHS at risk of huge gaps in its workforce, with hostility towards migrants blamed for the exodus.In all, 4,880 doctors who qualified in another country left the UK during 2024 – a rise of 26% on the 3,869 who did so the year before – figures from the General Medical Council reveal. Continue reading...

clusters.title: CDC website altered to reflect RFK Jr’s belief in link between vaccines and autism
clusters.neutral_headline: CDC website altered to reflect RFK Jr’s belief in link between vaccines and autism

items.title: CDC website altered to reflect RFK Jr’s belief in link between vaccines and autism
items.standfirst: Public health and autism specialists roundly condemn alteration to the ‘vaccine safety’ webpageA Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website has been changed to reflect the belief of Robert F Kennedy Jr, the US health and human services secretary, that there is a link between vaccines and autism, a view flatly contradicted by experts and scientifically validated studies.Public health and autism specialists roundly condemned the alteration to the CDC’s “vaccine safety” webpage, after it was changed to read: “The statement ‘Vaccines do not cause autism’ is not an evidence-based claim.” Continue reading...
items.content: Public health and autism specialists roundly condemn alteration to the ‘vaccine safety’ webpageA Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) website has been changed to reflect the belief of Robert F Kennedy Jr, the US health and human services secretary, that there is a link between vaccines and autism, a view flatly contradicted by experts and scientifically validated studies.Public health and autism specialists roundly condemned the alteration to the CDC’s “vaccine safety” webpage, after it was changed to read: “The statement ‘Vaccines do not cause autism’ is not an evidence-based claim.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The CDC website was altered to reflect Robert F Kennedy Jr's belief.
The alteration suggests a link between vaccines and autism.
Experts and studies contradict the belief.
Public health specialists condemned the change.
The original statement was changed on the webpage.

clusters.title: Prozac ‘no better than placebo’ for treating children with depression, experts say
clusters.neutral_headline: Prozac ‘no better than placebo’ for treating children with depression, experts say

items.title: Prozac ‘no better than placebo’ for treating children with depression, experts say
items.standfirst: Exclusive: Clinical guidelines should change to avoid exposing young people to potentially harmful side-effects, researchers sayClinical guidelines should no longer recommend Prozac for children, according to experts, after research showed it had no clinical benefit for treating depression in children and adolescents.Globally one in seven 10- to 19-year-olds have a mental health condition, according to the World Health Organization. In the UK, about a quarter of older teenagers and up to a fifth of younger children have anxiety, depression or other mental health problems. Continue reading...
items.content: Exclusive: Clinical guidelines should change to avoid exposing young people to potentially harmful side-effects, researchers sayClinical guidelines should no longer recommend Prozac for children, according to experts, after research showed it had no clinical benefit for treating depression in children and adolescents.Globally one in seven 10- to 19-year-olds have a mental health condition, according to the World Health Organization. In the UK, about a quarter of older teenagers and up to a fifth of younger children have anxiety, depression or other mental health problems. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Experts say Prozac is no better than a placebo for children.
Research showed no clinical benefit for treating depression.
Clinical guidelines should change, according to researchers.
The guidelines should avoid exposing young people to side effects.
One in seven 10- to 19-year-olds have a mental health condition.
